info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 6:28AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern McDowell, northwestern Rutherford and eastern Buncombe Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 626 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles southeast of Marshall to 8 miles east of Downtown Asheville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Fairview In Buncombe County, Lake Lure, Old Fort, the B.R. Parkway between East Asheville and Little Switzerland, Warren Wilson College, Chimney Rock State Park, and Chimney Rock Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
